intro: Lomaria fraseri var. philippense, commonly known as the Philippine lomaria, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has slender, climbing stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
